title: Robert Pattinson 'Beat Himself Up' On The Sets Of 'The Lighthouse,' Reveals His Co-Star
text:
By now we know only too well how far actors go in order to get in to character. Some actors even isolate themselves: Daniel Day-Lewis reportedly didn't break character for three whole months. He later went on to bag the best actor award at the Oscars.

Twitter

And given the latest reports, it seems Robert Pattinson is not too far behind either. According to his co-star he "beat himself up" on the sets his upcoming film The Lighthouse in order to get in to character.

Yes. His co-star Willem Dafoe shared this interesting fact in a recent interview. He said, "He's not interested in craft, I think. He wants to throw himself into deep water and he feels like it will only be true if he's drowning."

"For me, that seemed wacky. But I'm not trying to judge. He has a good sense of the visual, of what's needed in a close-up. Sometimes he'd beat himself up so bad. He'd stick his fingers down his throat, things like that," he went on.

Twitter

Clearly every actor has his or her own way to master their craft, and as members of the audience we don't have much to complain about.
description: We have come across lots of news that the actors isolate themselves to get into the characters of their films and one of the classic examples is Daniel Day-Lewis who locked himself for years to get into the character of Lincoln. And the latest we hear this Hollywood star used to beat himself on the sets of his film to get his character right and he is Robert Pattinson.
